WorkItem.Description: I have been successfully using ncalc in my project but am stumped on a new calculation that is throwing "missing EOF at '('" on Evaluate(). The code that is failing is "double finalResult = (double)expression.Evaluate();". The formula string is "(RetailUnits*RetailUnitCost)â€“((RetailUnits/UnitsPerCase)*WholesaleCaseCost)" all of the references are available as expression parameters. I've tried reformatting my expression to no avail. Is my syntax incorrect?

Comments.Message: I found the problem and it is not an ncalc issue. I used a string provided to me and the minus sign was NOT actually a minus sign so it errored out...
